com.bigdata.journal

Class RootBlockUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.journal.RootBlockUtility

  • public class RootBlockUtility
extends Object
    Utility class will read both root blocks of a file and indicate which one is current.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson

      IRootBlockView rootBlock1

    • Field Detail

      • rootBlock0

        public final IRootBlockView rootBlock0
        The 1st root block.

      • rootBlock1

        public final IRootBlockView rootBlock1
        The 2nd root block.

      • rootBlock

        public final IRootBlockView rootBlock
        The current root block. For a new file, this is "rootBlock0". For an existing file it is based on an examination of both root blocks.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RootBlockUtility

        public RootBlockUtility(IReopenChannel<FileChannel> opener,
                        File file,
                        boolean validateChecksum,
                        boolean alternateRootBlock,
                        boolean ignoreBadRootBlock)
                 throws IOException
        Parameters:
        opener -
        file -
        validateChecksum -
        alternateRootBlock - When true, the alternate root block will be chosen. This flag only makes sense when you have two root blocks to choose from and you want to choose the other one.
        ignoreBadRootBlock - When true, a bad root block will be ignored.
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        Options.ALTERNATE_ROOT_BLOCK, Options.IGNORE_BAD_ROOT_BLOCK

        public RootBlockUtility(BufferMode bufferMode,
                        int offsetBits,
                        long createTime,
                        long quorumToken,
                        UUID storeUUID)
        Generate the root blocks. They are for all practical purposes identical.
        Parameters:

        offsetBits -
        createTime -
        quorumToken -
        storeUUID -

    • Method Detail

      • chooseRootBlock

        public static IRootBlockView chooseRootBlock(IRootBlockView rootBlock0,
                                             IRootBlockView rootBlock1)
        Return the chosen root block. The root block having the greater commit counter is chosen by default.

        Note: For historical compatibility, rootBlock1 is chosen if both root blocks have the same IRootBlockView.getCommitCounter().

        Parameters:
        rootBlock0 - Root block 0 (may be null if this root block is bad).
        rootBlock1 - Root block 1 (may be null if this root block is bad).
        Returns:
        The chosen root block.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if no root block satisfies the criteria.

      • chooseRootBlock

        public IRootBlockView chooseRootBlock()
        Return the chosen root block. The root block having the greater commit counter is chosen by default.

        Note: For historical compatibility, rootBlock1 is chosen if both root blocks have the same IRootBlockView.getCommitCounter().

        Returns:
        The chosen root block.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if no root block satisfies the criteria.

      • chooseRootBlock

        public static IRootBlockView chooseRootBlock(IRootBlockView rootBlock0,
                                             IRootBlockView rootBlock1,
                                             boolean alternateRootBlock,
                                             boolean ignoreBadRootBlock)
        Return the chosen root block. The root block having the greater commit counter is chosen by default.

        Note: For historical compatibility, rootBlock1 is chosen if both root blocks have the same IRootBlockView.getCommitCounter().

        Parameters:
        rootBlock0 - Root block 0 (may be null if this root block is bad).
        rootBlock1 - Root block 1 (may be null if this root block is bad).
        alternateRootBlock - When true, the alternate root block will be chosen. This flag only makes sense when you have two root blocks to choose from and you want to choose the other one.
        ignoreBadRootBlock - When true, a bad root block will be ignored.
        Returns:
        The chosen root block.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if no root block satisfies the criteria.

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws IOException
        Dumps the root blocks for the specified file.
        Parameters:
        args - filename
        Throws:
        IOException
